page.title: 12BOTO-X 1985 (2)
page.content: A personal account. I was there as a member of Devizes School Canoeing Club "C" Team. There were eight members of the team, four for the first leg - downhill - and the other four, of whom I was one, for the second leg - uphill. On the Saturday it was wet, windy and cold so there were very few spectators. My team's heat was at five o'clock. By that time the ground at the start and finish area was a quagmire. We became freezing cold while waiting for the downhill leg team to reach us. With little sense of team- work the boat was unceremoniously hauled round the post. We ran down the bank shoving, hitting and coaxing our boat into the water. The uphill leg was more difficult than the downhill, because we had to
